com.software.reuze

Class ga_ErosionFunctionTalusAngle

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.software.reuze.ga_a_ErosionFunction
      • com.software.reuze.ga_ErosionFunctionTalusAngle

  • public class ga_ErosionFunctionTalusAngle
extends ga_a_ErosionFunction
    For each neighbor it's computed the difference between the processed cell and the neighbor: 
     d[i] = h - h[i];
    the maximum positive difference is stored in d_max, and the sum of all the positive differences that are bigger than T (this number is n), the talus angle, is stored in d_tot. Now it's possible to update all the n cells (where d[i] is bigger than T) using this formula: 
     h[i] = h[i] + c * (d_max - T) * (d[i] / d_tot);
    and the main cell with this other formula: 
     h = h - (d_max - (n * d_max * T / d_tot));
    The Talus angle T is a threshold that determines which slopes are affected by the erosion, instead the c constant determines how much material is eroded.
